RadarRange.Wiki: Distance to recognize enemy characters: metres

RadarAngleX.Wiki: X angle for recognizing enemy characters: The current direction of line of sight is 0 degrees, and the top is +.

RadarAngleY.Wiki: Y angle for recognizing enemy characters: The current direction of line of sight is 0 degrees, and the top is +.

TerritorySize.Wiki: Distance of one's own territory. If the recognized player leaves this distance, it will return to its initial position.

ForceThreatOnFirstLocked.Wiki: Whether to always intimidate the player when recognizing the player for the first time

Attack1_Margin.Wiki: Play between attacks. Avoid vibration near the distance

Attack1_DelayMin.Wiki: Minimum delay time from when it becomes possible to attack until it attacks.

Attack1_DelayMax.Wiki: The longest delay time from when the attack becomes possible until it attacks.

Attack1_ConeAngle.Wiki: If the angle between the line of sight and the direction vector toward the target is within this angle, the attack is OK.

Attack2_Margin.Wiki: Play between attacks. Avoid vibration near the distance

Attack2_DelayMin.Wiki: Minimum delay time from when it becomes possible to attack until it attacks.

Attack2_DelayMax.Wiki: The longest delay time from when the attack becomes possible until it attacks.

Attack2_ConeAngle.Wiki: If the angle between the line of sight and the direction vector toward the target is within this angle, the attack is OK.

Attack3_Margin.Wiki: Play between attacks. Avoid vibration near the distance

Attack3_DelayMin.Wiki: Minimum delay time from when it becomes possible to attack until it attacks.

Attack3_DelayMax.Wiki: The longest delay time from when the attack becomes possible until it attacks.

Attack3_ConeAngle.Wiki: If the angle between the line of sight and the direction vector toward the target is within this angle, the attack is OK.

Attack4_Margin.Wiki: Play between attacks. Avoid vibration near the distance

Attack4_DelayMin.Wiki: Minimum delay time from when it becomes possible to attack until it attacks.

Attack4_DelayMax.Wiki: The longest delay time from when the attack becomes possible until it attacks.

Attack4_ConeAngle.Wiki: If the angle between the line of sight and the direction vector toward the target is within this angle, the attack is OK.
